helpers module¶

src.cyto.helpers.jaccard(A, B)[source]¶

Computes the Jaccard similarity index (overlap/union) between two line segments. For example A=[0.25,0.5], B=[0.3,0.75], jaccard(A, B) returns (0.5-0.3)/(0.75-0.25)

Parameters

  • A – list: a list with two elements that represent the start and end of a line segment.

  • B – list: a list with two elements that represent the start and end of a line segment.

Returns

  • jacc_indx - float, Jaccard similarity index.

src.cyto.helpers.morphology_distance(z1, z2)[source]¶

Computes the Wasserstein Distance after the standardization of the two curves. The result is raised to a high power (dist^8) in order to amplify distributional differences.

Parameters

  • z1 – numpy.array, shape = [m, 1] where m is the number of cells.

  • z2 – numpy.array, shape = [n, 1] where m is the number of cells.

Returns

float Wasserstein distance.

src.cyto.helpers.weighted_jaccard(A, B, z)[source]¶

Computes a weighted version of Jaccard similarity index (weight * overlap/union) between two line segments.

Parameters

  • A – list: a list with two elements that represent the start and end of a line segment.

  • B – list: a list with two elements that represent the start and end of a line segment.

  • z – numpy.array, shape = [m, 1] where m is the number of cells.

Returns

  • jacc_indx - float, weighted Jaccard similarity index.
